Posts.Content: erdie123 wrote: So I am seeking answers.  My dad just informed all of us kids yesterday that he had a painful lump in his breast.  It was pea sized and he noticed it about a month ago.  He also said under his arms has been swollen and sore for about the same amount of time.  He did go in and get it checked and they stuck a syringe in the lump and there was no fluid.  Our family has a history of breast cancer on both sides.  He goes in this week for further testing.  Anyway I have been absolutely worried sick.  He is 60 years old and none of us kids wants to even think of the thought of losing him now.  Has anyone heard of other things that can cause the swelling under the arms and a painful lump.  Now he says he can move the lump around also.  Anyway I know this is mostly about women here but my mother has also had pre cancer removed from her breast and has so far remained cancer free.  Also if it turns out to be cancer I sure hope it isn't too far that he can't beat it.    Log in to post a reply
